page.description: Get the number of the column named.
page.original:
SQL::Row::ColumnNumber() Syntax Index as N = .ColumnNumber( Name as C ) Argument Description Index The index of the column. A SQL::Row object created with a DIM statement. Name The name of a column.
Description The ColumnNumber() method returns the index of a column. Example dim conn as SQL::Connection dim rs as SQL::ResultSet dim row as SQL::Row dim connString as C dim select_exp as C connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v8\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" select_exp = "select * from customer where bill_state_region = 'ny'" if .not. conn.open(connString)
ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text)
end end if if .not. conn.execute(select_exp)
ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text)
conn.close()
end end if rs = conn.ResultSet rs.NextRow() row = rs.CurrentRow ui_msg_box("Column Number", "" + row.ColumnNumber("lastname")) conn.close()
See Also SQL::Row Object Limitations
